question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration.

======== Role ========
You are an experienced code expert. I am providing you with a software development requirement description and ask you to generate project code based on these requirements. Strictly follow the rules to help users generate complete project code with simple and understandable comments, without outputting anything else.

======== Output Rules ========
1. You should always generate complete, runnable code for the project, making sure the project is fully executable
2. Ensure that all code files you output are complete, without omitting any code
3. Before final output, carefully review and check all code to evaluate its executability. If the code cannot execute or contains errors, regenerate it
4. If the requirements involve external API access or require user data (images, videos, audio, etc.), please provide mock data

======== Project Requirements ========
Develop a webpage screenshot tool where users can input a URL and the tool automatically captures either a full-page screenshot or a specified area. The tool should support different screenshot sizes, and users should be able to download the captured images.

checklist.title: Is the URL input and screenshot capture functionality fully implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code correctly implements the URL input field and screenshot capture mechanism. Verify if both full-page and specified area screenshots work properly. Score 0 if the core capture functionality isn't implemented, 5 if only basic capture is available, 10 if both full-page and area selection options are fully functional with proper error handling for invalid URLs.

checklist.title: Is the area selection feature properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the area selection tool allows users to accurately define regions for screenshot capturing. Check if it includes resizable selection rectangles, precise coordinate tracking, and handles edge cases (like selections outside the viewport). Deduct 3 points if selection isn't visually indicated, 5 points if resize/move functionality is missing, and 5 points if the coordinates aren't properly captured. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the tool support different screenshot sizes and formats?
checklist.description: Review if the tool provides options for different screenshot resolutions (e.g., desktop, mobile, custom dimensions) and multiple export formats (PNG, JPEG, etc.). Verify if dimension changes properly affect the viewport/output. Deduct 3 points if only one resolution is supported, 3 points if only one format is available, and 4 points if custom dimensions aren't offered. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the download functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if screenshot images can be properly downloaded with appropriate filenames, formats, and quality settings. Verify that download works across major browsers and includes progress indicators for large screenshots. Deduct 5 points if download doesn't work on at least two major browsers, 3 points if filename customization is missing, and 2 points if there's no progress indicator for large captures. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid URLs, CORS issues, timeout errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Image editing tools after capture 2. OCR text extraction from screenshots 3. Auto-scroll capture for long pages 4. Delayed capture with countdown). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar screenshot functions 2. Function modules unrelated to screenshot capture (e.g., unnecessary social sharing) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core screenshot functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating capture logic, UI components, and download functionality), error handling practices, and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no performance considerations exist for large page captures. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual feedback during screenshot capture process. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for lack of loading indicators during capture, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
